definition: to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
to pick an auspicious day

sentences.english: Both boys pleaded guilty to the theft charge and face sentencing at a later date.
sentences.chinese: 這兩名男孩對該偷盜指控供認不諱，並將被擇日宣判。

sentences.english: As drunk by James Bond in the film "Die Another Day".
sentences.chinese: 這是讓詹姆斯邦德在電影“擇日而亡”中喝醉的酒。

sentences.english: Court of second instance will choose a sentencing date.
The judge states collegiate bench closes this case adjudicates choose an auspicious day after discussing.
sentences.chinese: 法官表示合議庭合議後將擇日宣判此案。

sentences.english: This boss carefully selected this day to celebrate the big opening of his new restaurant close to Beijing Road.
sentences.chinese: 這個老闆擇日爲在北京路附近的新餐廳舉行開張慶典。

sentences.english: The court has choose an auspicious day adjudging to this case.
sentences.chinese: 法院將擇日對該案進行宣判。

definition: all of a sudden/hurriedly
circumstances/fate
easy money/windfall/ill-gotten gains/undeserved fortune/illegal profit
to lack male offspring
to alter one's fate/to improve one's luck (e.g. by changing one's name or phone number)
to break ground (prior to building sth)/to start building
to seek luck and avoid calamity (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to dispel doubts/to clear up difficulties
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
poe divination, a traditional Chinese divination method where a pair of crescent-shaped wooden or bamboo blocks is thrown on the ground, with the positions of the blocks determining the divine answer
variegated/heterogeneous/to refute/to contradict/to ship by barge/a barge/a lighter (ship)
time/one of the 12 two-hour periods of the day
affinity/in-laws
the undertaker's/funeral parlor
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
